name: Check Point Firewall
description: This app supports a variety of endpoint and network based containment actions on Check Point Firewall

url.description: Management Server URL with port (e.g. https://10.10.10.10:443)

actions.description: Validate the asset configuration for connectivity
actions.verbose: This action logs into the device using a REST API call to check the connection and credentials configured.

The ip parameter supports the following formats:
  • Simple IP: For example 123.123.123.123
  • IP, Subnet mask: 123.123.0.0 255.255.0.0
  • CIDR Notation: 123.123.0.0/16
This action takes multiple steps to block an IP/subnet:
  • Log in to the REST endpoint on Check Point to get a session ID.
  • Check for an existing network object for the supplied IP/subnet.
  • Add the network object if it does not already exist.
  • Check for a rule associated with the network object if it already exists.
  • Create a rule at the top of the policy that drops all traffic going to the supplied IP/subnet.
  • Publish the session.
  • Push the changes to the policy's configured firewalls.

The ip parameter supports the following formats:
  • Simple IP: For example 123.123.123.123
  • IP, Subnet mask: 123.123.0.0 255.255.0.0
  • CIDR Notation: 123.123.0.0/16
This action takes multiple steps to unblock an IP/subnet:
  • Log in to the REST endpoint on Check Point to get a session ID.
  • Check for an existing network object for the supplied IP/subnet.
  • Check for a rule associated with the network object if it exists.
  • Delete the rule if it exists.
  • Publish the session.
  • Push the changes to the policy's configured firewalls.

The ip parameter supports the following formats:
  • IPv4: For example 123.123.123.123
  • IPv6: For example 2001:0db8:0000:0000:0000:ff00:0042:7879
This action will always prioritize using the ip parameter unless ipv4 and/or ipv6 parameters are specified. If both ipv4 and ipv6 addresses are required, use the corresponding parameters explicitly.

name.description: Object/host name (must be unique in the domain)

ip.description: IPv4 or IPv6 address to add (if both addresses are required use ipv4 and ipv6 fields explicitly)

actions.verbose: To delete a host, either specify uid or name. If provided both, this action will prioritize the uid parameter.

name.description: Object/host name (must be unique in the domain)

actions.verbose: This action logs out of the current session unless another session ID is specified.

session_id.description: Session ID to log out from

example_values:
Could not connect to Check Point:
Wrong session id. Session may be expired. Please check session id and resend the request.
